subject_terms_3: Textile art and design Indian costumes
physical_appearance: This is a long piece of cloth, used as a turban. It is gold in colour, with brocading. The ends of the cloth feature a geometric design made of silver sequins and embroidered thread. The ends are slightly frayed. The ends of the turban cloth is laid out on the right, while the rest of the length of the fabric is collected on the right.
sgcool_label_text: This length of fine brocade, embellished with embroidery and silver sequins, is a turban cloth. It would have been used by aristocracy or royalty in Rajasthan
